subject: RE: [junit] Assert Message On Success
msgSnippet: You can t easily do this (in JUnit 3).  The assert* methods don t support it and there s no easy way to modify their behavior, as they re static methods.

You can't easily do this (in JUnit 3).  The assert* methods don't
support it and there's no easy way to modify their behavior, as they're
static methods.  You're not the first person to ask this question.  I
call this (as-yet non-existent) feature "logging asserts".  See here for
a prior discussion about this: 
 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/12878
 
 
Todd.


________________________________

	From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Gerry Smith
	Sent: Wednesday, August 03, 2005 7:53 AM
	To: junit@yahoogroups.com
	Subject: [junit] Assert Message On Success
	
	
	Does anyone know how to get the Message variable in the Assert
to print 
	even if an error does not occur? I would like to put a
descriptive 
	message in each assert condition that I can print out for each
test to 
	display in the "type" field of the generated junitreport. 
	
	For instance: 
	
	Assert.assertEqual("I want to print this message pass or fail",
String, 
	String);
	
	When I do this I would like to get the message in the generated 
	junitreport regardless of success or failure. Any suggestions?
	
	Gerry Smith
